item.title: Scalable Ruby Processing with EventMachine
item.description: I gave a talk at Austin On Rails last night on using EventMachine, focused on maximizing concurrency when processing a message queue. There were a lot of questions, mostly revolving around the flow of execution within EventMachine code. To this point, there were two common stumbling points people seemed to have: Ruby developers are not used to treating blocks as true callbacks where they are executing at some point in the future.

item.title: Ruby Scoping Oddity
item.description: This prints out “1”: ` begin a = 1 raise RuntimeError, "foo" rescue => e puts a end ` I would think that a would be out of scope inside the rescue section but I guess Ruby considers the rescue section part of the begin/end block?
